alert.note: Alert for Highland; Pike; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 10:05PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ADAMS, PIKE, SOUTHEASTERN HIGHLAND, SCIOTO AND SOUTHERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM EDT... At 1005 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Kincaid Springs, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Portsmouth, Wheelersburg, Waverly, West Union, New Boston, Piketon, Peebles, Winchester, Seaman, South Webster, Bainbridge, Rosemount, Clarktown, Rome, Lucasville, Franklin Furnace, Pike Lake, Kincaid Springs and Sciotodale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southwestern Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for northeastern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
